com.milk.command
Interface Command

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseCommand
public interface Command

A Command is a user-activatable action of some sort.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Method Detail

addListener

public void addListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
Add a listener for this command. The listener will get any events that it defines interfaces for. Command itself is defined to only ever send CommandEvents, but actual implementations may send other event types. If the listener is in fact a CommandListener, then it immediately gets sent three events indicating the state of the command: a labelChanged event, a descriptionChanged event, and an enabledChanged event.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to add
See Also:
CommandEvent, CommandListener

removeListener

public void removeListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
Remove a listener from this command that was previously added with addListener.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to remove

getLabel

public java.lang.String getLabel()
Get the label of this command. The label is a short string which succinctly names this command. The return value should never be null; "" is acceptable, however.

Returns:
non-null; the label

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
Get the full description of this command. It is suitable for tool-tips or the like. The return value should never be null; "" is acceptable, however.

Returns:
non-null; the description

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
Return true if this command is currently enabled. If it is enabled, then run() should work. If it is not, then run() should not work.

Returns:
true if this command is currently enabled

makeArgument

public java.lang.Object makeArgument()
Create and return an argument template for this command. If the template is null, then this command has no arguments. If it is non-null, it may be any object, but, for the purposes of allowing humans to interact with the command, it is generally best for it to be an Editable of some sort.

Returns:
non-null; a new argument template for this command, or null if the command has no arguments
See Also:
Editable

run

public java.lang.Object run(java.lang.Object argument)
                     throws DisabledCommandException
Run the command with the given argument. The argument should be an object that was previously returned from makeArgument.

Parameters:
argument - the argument of the command
Returns:
null-ok; the return value of running the command
Throws:
DisabledCommandException - thrown if the command is not enabled at the time this method is called
